query: what is the latest tech news happening in the UK?

articles.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Review: Bigger and Better, for a Higher Price
articles.description: The hardware improvements in the new $450 Nintendo will make this an automatic upgrade for fans of the two-in-one console.

articles.title: This A.I. Company Wants to Take Your Job
articles.description: Mechanize, a San Francisco start-up, is building artificial intelligence tools to automate white-collar jobs “as fast as possible.”

articles.title: Elon Musk Says His Trump Criticisms ‘Went Too Far’
articles.description: President Trump and Elon Musk traded social media barbs last week. Mr. Trump has said that he has no interest in repairing the relationship with his former adviser.

articles.title: Amid LA Protests, Conspiracy Theories and Fake Images Spread Online
articles.description: Disinformation spreading on social media platforms has stoked an already tense situation.

articles.title: Google DeepMind and National Hurricane Center Join on New A.I. Model
articles.description: The National Hurricane Center will experiment with the company’s DeepMind program to enhance the work of its expert meteorologists.

articles.title: Charging Your EV May Be Getting Easier, Even if It’s Not a Tesla
articles.description: It is becoming easier to find fast chargers for electric vehicles, and they are more likely to work — and not just for Teslas.

articles.title: John L. Young, 89, Dies; Pioneered Posting Classified Documents Online
articles.description: His site, Cryptome, was a precursor to WikiLeaks, and in some ways bolder in its no-holds-barred approach to exposing government secrets.

articles.title: Los Angeles Protests Amplified by Influencers and Online Creators
articles.description: Creators such as Cam Higby, who is conservative, have sometimes outnumbered traditional media outlets at the immigration protests. Their posts have gone viral.

articles.title: How ‘Maybe Happy Ending’ Overcame a Shaky Start and Won Big at the Tonys
articles.description: Broadway’s best musical winner had to delay its opening last fall and was selling poorly. But strong word-of-mouth and reviews helped this quirky show triumph.

articles.title: As Energy Costs Surge, Eastern Governors Blame a Grid Manager
articles.description: Anger at PJM, which manages the electrical grid in all or parts of 13 states and the District of Columbia, has been boiling over in some state capitals.

articles.title: Data bill opposed by Sir Elton John and Dua Lipa finally passes
articles.description: Leading artists said the bill needed to be changed to protect them from having their work copied by AI.

articles.title: Meta urged to go further in crackdown on 'nudify' apps
articles.description: The apps use artificial intelligence to create fake nude images of people without their consent.

articles.title: Disney and Universal sue AI firm Midjourney over images
articles.description: The Hollywood studios allege Midjourney's image generator is a "bottomless pit of plagiarism".

articles.title: WhatsApp tells BBC it backs Apple in legal row with UK over user data
articles.description: The messaging app says the UK government's demands over data access could set a "dangerous precedent."

articles.title: 4chan and porn site investigated by Ofcom over online safety
articles.description: Nine companies are under investigation by Ofcom, using powers of the Online Safety Act.

articles.title: Uber brings forward trialling driverless taxis in UK
articles.description: The autonomous cars with no human safety driver at the wheel will be trialled in London next spring.

articles.title: China's electric cars are becoming slicker and cheaper - but is there a deeper cost?
articles.description: The future for EVs will inevitably involve China. But where does that leave the UK and Europe markets – and what of the questions around national security?

articles.title: Government considers social media time limits for children
articles.description: The BBC understands proposals include a two-hour cap on apps and a 22:00 curfew.

articles.title: Will Musk's explosive row with Trump help or harm his businesses?
articles.description: Experts say his tech empire needs more of Musk's attention - but also the continued custom of the government.
